questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Asia is renowned for its grand temples constructed during the Khmer Empire?
questions.context: Built in the early 12th century as a Hindu temple dedicated to Vishnu, it is the largest religious monument in the world.

questions.question: This now serene location in Germany was the site of the closing battle of World War II in Europe and now has a museum dedicated to the event. Which site is it?
questions.context: The Battle of Berlin marked the end of the European conflict in May 1945, leading to the surrender of Nazi Germany.

questions.question: Which famous museum in Paris, once a royal palace, houses the Mona Lisa and other world-renowned artworks?
questions.context: Formerly a royal palace, the Louvre became a public museum during the French Revolution and is the world's most visited museum.

questions.question: What modern architectural marvel, known for its sail-like structure, is located in Australia and hosts over 1,500 performances annually?
questions.context: Completed in 1973, this iconic building is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and exemplifies 20th-century architectural design.

questions.question: What ancient ruin in South America, built in the 15th century, is known for its terrace farming and was rediscovered by a Yale historian in 1911?
questions.context: Located at 2,430 meters (7,970 ft) above sea level, it's one of the most iconic symbols of the Incan Empire.
